New Records: Domantas Sabonis set a new Sacramento-era record for most rebounds in a single game with 28 rebounds, surpassing his previous record of 26 rebounds.
Key Match Events: Domantas Sabonis scored 23 points on 10-of-15 shooting and three-of-four from three-point range.
DeMar DeRozan scored 24 points, with half of them in the fourth quarter.
Malik Monk added 22 points, while Keegan Murray and Devin Carter contributed 19 and 11 points respectively.
The Kings secured 16 offensive rebounds and won the turnover battle.
The Kings held the Celtics to 11/41 from three-point range, despite the Celtics averaging a league-high 49.8 three-point attempts per game.
Post-Match Reflections: The Kings have rebounded from a six-game losing streak with a six-game winning streak under interim head coach Doug Christie.
Domantas Sabonis has elevated his game, leading the league in rebounds per game and double-doubles, and is fourth in triple-doubles.
The Kings are firmly back in the Western Conference playoff race.
